alert.note: Alert for Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 12 at 1:23AM AKST until January 12 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills ranging 40 to 55 below are occurring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * WHEN...Through 9 PM Wednesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Westerly winds gusting to 30 mph will continue to lead to wind chills ranging 40 to 55 below. These gusty winds will also lead to areas of blowing and drifting snow. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.
